results.title: Drugs and beyond
results.creator_credit: Extension Media Center, University of California
results.brief_description: Raises the question of whether a variety of mind controlling substances can be used for positive purposes such as increased learning power, memory stimulation, accelerated maturing processes, mood change or tension control. The emphasis is on manipulation of consciousness or behaviour rather than alteration or awareness expansion.

results.title: Drugs - better dead?
results.brief_description: An undramatised documentary which shows the harrowing effects of drug misuse. Young addicts and ex-addicts give accounts of what life is like on various drugs, how they experience withdrawal symptoms and their need for more and more money to buy the drugs. Glimpses are seen of a post-mortem examination being conducted on the body of a young female addict.

results.title: Drug use & young people: together we can make a difference
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Human Services and Victoria. Office of Youth Affairs
results.brief_description: Terry Laidler presents the second in a series of interactive seminars linking a Statewide panel via satellite to 25 rural centres. The Victorian Premier’s Drug Advisory Council report forms the basis of discussion surrounding the issue of youth drug use in Victoria. The panel includes The Hon. Denis Napthine, Minister, Youth & Community Services, Professor Greg Whelan, Alcohol and Drug Unit, St. Vincent’s Hospital, Robert Bellhouse, a writer of drug education material for use in schools and Peter Wearne, director of Theos Youth Centre (St. Kilda) with 20 years experience working with young people in crisis. During the seminar, the panel fields questions from studio participants, by fax and telephone.

results.title: Drug of choice
results.creator_credit: Searle Educational Systems and Alfred Kelman
results.brief_description: A film about alcoholism showing it as a chronic disease which gets progressively worse. A key factor is the career phenomenon, with the process starting during lunch.

results.title: Drug abuse: self awareness for high school students - fear
results.brief_description: John persuades Suzanne to collect a consignment of drugs for him. She, at first unwilling eventually agrees. During the film there are inserts of comments by people on drug taking, trust, child/parent relationships, police, fear, etc.

results.title: Drug abuse: one town's answer
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates and Pat Shields
results.brief_description: The story of the Awareness House concept, as begun in Fort Bragg, California, which provides a meaningful alternative to drugs. “Turn on to people, not drugs”. Ex-addicts, who are experienced drug specialists, provide counselling and realistic drug abuse information. The teenagers involved talk freely about their reasons for giving up narcotics.

results.title: Drowning: facts and myths
results.brief_description: A water safety film showing examples of drowning cases that illustrate these safety rules: never swim alone, always watch young children when they are in the water, fence backyard swimming pools, don’t depend on inflatables and wear lifejackets when boating.
results.description: A water safety film showing examples of drowning cases that illustrate these safety rules: never swim alone, always watch young children when they are in the water, fence backyard swimming pools, don’t depend on inflatables and wear lifejackets when boating.
